definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Doug: Do you need someone to come along with you? I'm free tonight.
sentences.chinese: 需要有人陪你吗？我今天晚上有空喔。

sentences.english: How to do it well kind the website, free to look.
sentences.chinese: 如何做好鹤壁信息港类的网站，有空看一下。

sentences.english: Oh, great. Dr. Johnson will be available on Friday afternoon this week.
sentences.chinese: 太好了，约翰逊大夫本周星期五下午有空。

sentences.english: Dr. Joh on will be available on Friday afternoon this week.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊大夫本周周五有空。

sentences.english: We're going to have a barbecue sometime this month. Are you available on the 17th?
sentences.chinese: 我们这个月要找一天去烤肉。你十七号有空吗？

sentences.english: Hi, Lucy, are you free to talk?
sentences.chinese: 你好，露西，你有空说一下话吗？

sentences.english: I am just saying Mr. Jenny will not be free till these evening.
sentences.chinese: 刚才是说詹纳斯先生要到今天晚上才有空。

sentences.english: or “Do you have any time today to do something fun together?
sentences.chinese: 或“今天有空一起做点什么有趣的事么？”

sentences.english: It was also found thatthere are plaques without closely packed polyg…
sentences.chinese: 同时也观察到在较大的缝隙连接中有空斑存在。

sentences.english: What do you usually do in your spare time?
sentences.chinese: 你有空的时候，通常做些什么？

sentences.english: Cheng Rushan also let chat when you re free and the sunrise.
sentences.chinese: 程如山还让有空的时候和小曦聊聊。

sentences.english: Johnson will be available on Friday afternoon this week.
sentences.chinese: 太好了，约翰逊大夫本周星期五下午有空。

sentences.english: Hi, Su Hai, Are you free now?No. We're doing housework.
sentences.chinese: 你好，苏海，你现在有空吗？不。我正在做家务。

sentences.english: I'll go with you to the cinema this mid-day if I'm free.
sentences.chinese: 若是本日下午我有空的话，就和你一齐去看电影。

definition: to (try to) find the time to
another day/some other time/to find another day (for appointment etc)/to take a rain check
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
to find the time to do sth
to roam around/to have a stroll
in a moment/later/also pr. [dai1 hui3 r5] or [dai1 hui5 r5]
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
